Support for VA benefit limits must mean that war is winding down .

The May 17 letter writer who suggests that the way to improve VA services is to deny medical benefits to those with a mere two years of service ( or less ) must be referring to those of us who were drafted into involuntary military servitude during the Vietnam War and managed to survive it ( relatively ) unscathed .

It is hard for me to hear of fellow veterans dying while waiting to be treated .
It is also hard to hear of VA employees manipulating waiting list times to cover up the problem .
It is also hard to hear of VA employees manipulating waiting list times to cover up the problem .
What is worse is to hear members of Congress dumping the blame on them .

I do n't wish to indicate that these employees have no fault , but I want to point out that the problem did n't originate with the employees , but rather with the refusal of Congress to properly fund Veterans Affairs so that it might have the staff , equipment and facilities to meet the needs of our veterans .
